results.title: A Time for drunken horses = Zamani baraye masti asbha [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bahman Ghobadi Films and Bahman Ghobadi
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Bahman Ghobadi “A Time for drunken horses” is an Iranian film set amid the mountainous border of Iran and Iraq. Ayoub (Ayoub Ahmadi) is a twelve-year-old Kurdish boy who is burdened with the economic responsibility of providing for his family. He has four bothers and sisters, one of whom is severely disabled. To eek out a living in the harsh landscape where his family live, Ayoub joins his uncle in a dangerous trade - taking pack mules loaded with truck tyres across the Iranian border to Iraq. The work is fraught with perils as the road is treacherous, bandits roam the terrain and rough weather impedes the journey. Once at the border Ayoub and his uncle ply their meagre goods, along with numerous others, for a pittance. Ayoub’s brother Madi is in need of a life saving operation that is prohibitively expensive for the impoverished family. Ayoub works against all the hazards to raise the necessary money. “A Time for drunken horses” has the feel and look of a documentary, one that expresses poignantly the trials of a valiant and resourceful child and his destitute people. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: A Thousand acres
results.creator_credit: Beacon Pictures, Buena Vista, Prairie Films, Propaganda Films, Touchstone Pictures, Via Rosa, Marc Abraham, Steve Golin and Jocelyn Moorhouse
results.brief_description: Set in the Midwestern farm belt of the US, this meandering feminist melodrama is based on Jane Smiley’s novel which is itself an adaptation of Shakespeare’s “King Lear”. An aging patriarch (Jason Robards) decides impulsively to divide his prized thousand-acre farm between his three daughters but when the youngest (Jennifer Jason Leigh) tries to dissuade him, he disinherits her. When the other daughters (Jessica Lange, Michelle Pfeiffer) take up the offer, long repressed rivalries, unspoken secrets and regrets that both bind and divide the three women begin to surface. At the centre of the dysfunctional family dynamics is their controlling father, now rapidly declining into alcoholism and dementia. Written by Laura Jones.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beacon Pictures, Buena Vista, Prairie Films, Propaganda Films, Touchstone Pictures, Via Rosa, Marc Abraham, Steve Golin and Jocelyn Moorhouse

results.title: A Taste of honey
results.creator_credit: Bryanston Films, Continental, Woodfall Film Productions and Tony Richardson
results.brief_description: A kitchen sink drama from the early 1960s, “A Taste of Honey” is about a young Englishwoman, who lives with her hard drinking, floozy of a mother, Helen. When Helen impulsively marries her current boyfriend, Jo is turned out and moves in with Geoffrey, a kindly homosexual friend, himself an outsider. Their peaceful domesticity is interrupted when Jo falls pregnant after an affair with a black sailor. After the birth of the baby, Jo and Geoffrey are effectively co-parenting until Jo’s opportunistic mother re-emerges to stake her claim in her daughter’s life. Despite its depressing subject matter “A Taste of honey” entertains a blackly comic tone that keeps it from sliding into a draining melodrama. The film is a fascinating ‘slice-of-life’ view of working class life in Britain of the 60s, whose entrancing black and white cinematography, reminiscent of Bill Brandt’s photography of working class England, contrasts with the gauche and drab reality of the characters’ surrounds. This controversial film dealt with many taboo topics on the day - teen pregnancy, inter-racial romance, homosexuality, child abandonment, without excessive sermonising on the topics, typical of American moral dramas of the 1950s. Cast includes Dora Bryan, Rita Tushingham, Robert Stephens, Murray Melvin, Paul Danquah and David Boliver.

results.title: A Tale of Two Cities
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick and Jack Conway
results.brief_description: Based on Charles Dickens great novel, “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of turbulent times - the French revolution, recreated in breathtaking scale and painstaking detail. And it is a timeless tale - the story of two men in love with the same woman. Ronald Colman stars in what is perceived as the best role he ever played. “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of romance and revolution, politics and passion, but most of all it is a true classic for all time.

results.title: A Sunday in the Country = Un Dimanche a la Campagne
results.creator_credit: Sara Films, Films A2, Little Bear, Alain Sarde and Bertrand Tavernier
results.brief_description: A poignant and gently paced portrayal of one day in the life of M. Ladmiral, a French painter nearing the end of his life. As is usual on Sundays, M. Ladmiral is visited at his country home by his children from the city - the devoted Edouard with his petit bourgeois wife and three children and the lively Irene, M. Ladmiral’s beautiful daughter. This Sunday, as the day unfolds, a telling family portrait is gradually revealed with the sensitivity that only Tavernier can bring to the screen.

results.title: A Streetcar named Desire
results.creator_credit: Charles K. Feldman and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Blanche Dubois, a faded Southern belle whose fortunes have crumbled to nothing, comes to New Orleans to stay with her sister, Stella. Stella’s husband, the brutish but magnetic Stanley Kowalski is suspicious of her past and puts in train a devastating chain of events which will finally destroy for all time Blanche’s already tenuous grasp on the world of reality. Stars Vivien Leigh and Marlon Brando. Based on the play by Tennessee Williams. Also stars Karl Malden.

results.title: A Stitch in time
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Hugh Stewart and Robert Asher
results.brief_description: Norman Wisdom was famed for his ability to combine pathos and slapstick. In this motion picture he is an assistant to local butcher Mr. Grimsdale. During a hold up, Norman persuades Mr. Grimsdale to hide his gold watch in his mouth. This foolproof strategy comes unstuck when the watch is swallowed and Grimsdale has to be taken to hospital. Once there Norman is able to wreak havoc and chaos amongst patients and staff alike, but eventually his lovable charm wins the day and he manages to come out on top. Also stars Edward Chapman, Jerry Desmond and Lucy Appleby.

results.title: A Star is born [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, David O. Selznick and William Wellman
results.brief_description: The rise of a small-time singer to Hollywood stardom is matched by the decline of her actor-mentor, then husband. A melodrama, a musical comedy and a musical-within-a-musical which, beneath its mythmaking about Hollywood, achieves a rare depth of emotion and sense of truthfulness. Cast includes Janet Gaynor, Frederic March, Adolphe Menjou and May Robson.

results.title: A Song to remember
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Louis F. Edelman and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: Cornel Wilde is the tragic composer Chopin and Merle Oberon plays the radical feminist writer George Sands. ‘A Song to remember’ tells the story of this great pianist, fighting for the freedom of his beloved Poland and inspired by two beautiful women - one who loved him selflessly; the other who was cruel and aloof. Chopin’s life and genius was cut short in the full flower of his musical greatness. ‘A Song to remember’ is a sentimental costume drama and features the skilled playing of Jose Iturbi. This film was nominated for seven Academy Awards and also stars Paul Muni as Chopin’s mentor and nina Foch.
